text: Austro-Hungary's Luftfahrtruppen contained many aviators of Czech origin, i.e. ethnic Czechs and men born in the territory of the modern-day Czech Republic. The flying aces among them are listed below. At least one flier in the German Luftstreitkräfte was also of Czech origin. {| class="wikitable sortable" ! Name !! Victories !! Notes |- | Julius Arigi | 32 victories | Austro-Hungarian Empire's second scoring ace served in World War II in the German Luftwaffe.Franks et al (1997), p. 172. |- | Paul Billik | 31 victories | Served in the German Luftstreitkräfte.Franks et al (1993), p. 74. |- | Eugen Bönsch | 16 victories | Served in the Luftwaffe during World War II.Franks et al (1997), pp. 174-175. |- | Ernst Strohschneider | 15 victoriesO'Connor, pp. 60, 289-290. | |- | Otto Jindra | 9 victories | Postwar commander of the Czech Air Force.Franks et al (1997), pp. 184-185. |- | Heinrich Kostrba | 8 victories | First commanding officer of the Czechoslovakian Flying Corps.Franks et al (1997), pp. 188-189. |- | Josef Friedrich | 7 victoriesO'Connor, p. 306. | |- | Otto Jäger | 7 victoriesFranks et al (1997), p. 184. | |- | Andreas Dombrowski | 6 victoriesFranks et al (1997), p. 177. | |- | Kurt Nachod | 5 victoriesFranks et al (1997), p. 193. | |- | Karl Nikitsch | 6 victoriesFranks et al (1997), pp. 194-195. | |- | Karl Patzelt | 5 victoriesFranks et al (1997), pp. 195-196. | | |- | Karl Teichmann | 5 victoriesFranks et al (1997), p. 202. | |- |} ==See also== * List of World War I flying aces from Austria-Hungary * List of World War I flying aces * List of World War I flying aces from Austria * List of World War I flying aces from Hungary * List of World War I Slovakian flying aces ==References== ==Further reading== * Franks, Norman; Guest, Russell; Alegi, Gregory (1997). Above the War Fronts: the British Two-seater Bomber Pilot and Observer Aces, the British Two-seater Fighter Observer Aces, and the Belgian, Italian, Austro-Hungarian and Russian Fighter Aces, 1914-1918: Volume 4 of Fighting Airmen of WWI Series: Volume 4 of Air Aces of WWI. title: List of World War I Czech flying aces
